title.narrative: PSYCHOSOCIAL SERVICES

description.narrative: Effective psychosocial services and community-based interventions are available for child victims of abuse, exploitation and violence and children affected by emergencies, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By December 2016, child victims of abuse and violence and children who come into contact and conflict with the law will benefit from improved child protection services.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Effective psychosocial services and community-based interventions are available for child victims of abuse, exploitation andviolence and children affected by emergencies

description.narrative: Partnerships among social services were strengthened to reduce re-traumatization of child victims of abuse and better protect children in emergencies | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/12/2016

title.narrative: of children with access to comprehensive mental health services for children in state care

baseline.value: Limited access to mental health services by children in state care

target.value: 2015:1000 children have access to mental health services children in state care through the services of a mobile mental health unit

actual.value: 2016:Support to this programme ended in 2015. During the Country Programme, 467 children in state care had access to mental health services through a mobile mental health unit

title.narrative: Status of comprehensive mental health service provision for children in the care of the state

baseline.value: Limited access to mental health services by wards of the state

target.value: 2015:Access to mental health services by wards of the state increased through the services of a mobile mental health unit

actual.value: 2016:Mobile mental health service was sustained by the Government at project end for the benefit of all children in the care of the state.

title.narrative: Status of inter-agency mechanism to safeguard the rights of children in emergencies

target.value: 2015:Inter-agency mechanism to safeguard the rights of children in emergencies established

actual.value: 2016:No inter-agency mechanism in place focusing on children only. Emergency Preparedness and Response Plan (EPRP) template and guidelines incorporated into Ministry of Education's Schools Safety & Security Manual and institutionalized in government and private children's homes

title.narrative: % of new walk-in cases of child abuse processed within the first week of incident reporting

target.value: 2015:100% in three parishes serviced by social workers

actual.value: 2016:Support to this activity ended in 2015. During the Country Programme, 100% of new walk-in cases of child abuse were seen within the first week of incident reporting by the CDA/CISOCA project

title.narrative: of children receiving services from CISOCA through CDA Social Workers

actual.value: 2016:Support to this project ended in 2015. During the Country Programme, 811 children received services from CDA Social Workers through this activity
